body: Rene Gross of Flatbush has seen a few county fairs in her day, but never one with a kosher concession stand. Sean Adams of East New York began horseback riding two years ago, but had never seen a rodeo, let alone one where almost all the cowboys were black. But there they were yesterday: Mrs. Gross pushing a stroller over an old runway at Floyd
title: Deep in the Heart of Brooklyn, Cowboys and Kosher Food

body: A Brooklyn family's annual backyard barbecue ended in bloodshed early yesterday when a group of teen-age boys tried to crash the party and then returned, armed and angry, after they were refused. Witnesses and police investigators said the youths stood across the street and at least one opened fire indiscriminately into the party-goers, a crowd of
title: Youths Fire Into Crowd At Barbecue, Killing Host

body: SIX months after the director Spike Lee joined forces with DDB Needham Worldwide to open a joint-venture agency, their fledgling shop has already accumulated a robust roster of accounts with billings that they estimate at $35 million. But Mr. Lee and his giant partner still confront challenges as they seek business from mainstream marketers. ''We
title: Spike DDB is off to a fast start, but obstacles remain.

title: Sampling of Musical Events for the Easter Season

body: Under election laws, candidates for mayor must live in the city 30 days before the September primaries. So last month, the Rev. Al Sharpton moved his family from Englewood, N.J., to Brooklyn. Mr Sharpton, who announced his candidacy last week, picked Ditmas Park, a community characterized by small-town solitude in the heart of the city's most
title: From Here To Gracie Mansion, Contenders Hope
